Posts.Content: Dec 15, 2013 01:29PM tangandchris wrote: Well I had my breaking point this morning when I woke up. I had been to the BS monday and she saw the incision site looking swollen and red, she changed my antibiotics Minocycline. I went to PS on WED and even though the incision site seemed to be getting worse, he insisted that it wasn't infected and that it was just my skin dying. lol, okay. So, as the week goes on I'm feeling more and more miserable, I can't get out of bed, I feel constantly sick at my stomach. I was going completely backwards in my recovery. I realized that maybe it was the antibiotics making me sick, so I called the doc and he changed me to augmenten. anyway, this morning when I woke up my incision is just dripping with greenish-yellow fluid, my gauze pad is soaked thru. I'm freaked out!!! I call the answering service, finally get a call back and PS has me text pics of my horrible looking flaps to him. He still says no infection, that the skin is going to eventually scab over and will be okay. I am wondering if this surgery has been this rough to recover from, how the heck will I get thru chemo/radio?? I feel like things are never going to be okay again, this is the new normal and I'm scared. I broke down this morning, husband was at work, I'm at home with my 4 year old alone and I just fell out. I called my dad/step mom and they came over to help me. I HATE feeling like a burden and helpless.   I'm venting and realize that my post probably was hard to follow. I don't know where else to go with all this stuff. My family and friends are there for me, but I feel so dark emotionally sometimes and I don't want them to know how I'm feeling. It's just bad.....   I'm trying to remember daily that I'm blessed, that the Lord is with me and in control. This is just a hard time....thanks for listening.

Posts.Content: Jul 13, 2014 06:40AM tangandchris wrote: Mom-I totally understand how you are feeling, I wanted to quit after each tx...no joke. It was rough and I hated every moment of it. I did 6 rounds of TAC and spent most of that time in a rough place. BUT-I got thru it. I know it is hard and sucks, someone on here told me they felt like it was legal torture. I'd say that you first need to call your MO and talk with them about your SE's. I had to get fluids alot too and that helped me out. I had hot flashes too, I just dealt with it. ((Hugs)) Hang in there girl. If your MO feels like things need to be adjusted I've heard of that happening too. Maybe the dosage of your chemo is too much. IDK, but talking with them can hopefully give you answers. Grade 3 is the most aggressive and that is probably why the chemo has been recommended.

Posts.Content: Oct 10, 2014 05:18PM tangandchris wrote: I had a seroma on my left side(proph side) that gave me hell. It was painful, the pressure would build up and caused me intense pain. The other issue is that seromas can be a breeding ground for infection. I had mine drained several times and finally I had to have a surgery to remove scar tissue that was trapping the fluid. I would have a needed inserted into my chest to drain the fluid and the doctor told me it was almost as if I had honeycomb like tissue in there. After the surgery it improved, although I did have a drain in for sometime even after that. Good luck, I know how difficult it can be!
